pros: Family and team oriented, flexible
cons: Hierarchical at times, low pay

cons: Minimum wage pay/salary, but it makes sense for the workload

pros: Small campus, tight knit, friendly workplace

pros: Small family-like culture. Very accessible administration. Flexible working conditions. Its easy to maintain relationships with students.

pros: Everyone that worked there was extremely dedicated to the mission and helping students.  I had all the resources I needed to help students succeed.
cons: Lots of down time with little to do.

pros: Amazing place! Great staff and admin, love how the university takes care of its students

review_title: Great place to work as a student
pros: Close to classes | Friendly and diverse environment | Flexible work hours | Good benefits (depending on job) | Great supplemental training | Learn how the university operates
cons:
Low pay | Co-workers can be a hassle to work with at times (most student workers are young and immature)

There aren't really too many cons associated with the university, so I'm just adding this line down here to hit the 20 word minimum.

pros: Family atmosphere and great support. Educational benefit was great! The campus is gorgeous. Felt it had support from my immediate line of business.
cons: Slow to move and take action. Pay was low but the educational benefit makes up for it. Found that most things were not digital in terms of forms and lots of manual inputs required. Need set processes.

pros: It was good while it lasted.
cons: Very political. The President does not base his decisions on valid data for funding. It is a club for the Marianists Brothers to take care of each other.

review_title: Dead end Job. They let you work more than 20 hours until you ask for health insurance or tuition assistance
pros: You have time to do your homework and watch TV
cons: Dead end Job. They let you work more than 20 hours until you ask for health insurance or to pay for a class like the regular employees receive as a benefit.  Underpaid. No room for advancement.

pros: The campus is very friendly and safe. I feel like everywhere I walk to I'm always greeting someone I know. I got to develop certain skills such as networking, critical thinking, and time management.
cons: Parking is very hard if you have midmorning or afternoon classes because the parking structure would already be packed.

review_title: Great way to pay for school, not so great place to make a living
pros: Free Tuition for full time employees. Wonderful staff and students. Fun campus events with food and music.
cons: $14 per hour for a full time position is not enough to make a living.

job_title: Director of Systems Integration in Honolulu, HI
pros: Love working here.  Everyone here is like family and the senior leaders really do care for the students, staff, and faculty.
cons: Campus is steep and on a hill.  But, you definitely get a workout coming to work.

review_title: Director of MIS with Roles as System/DB Admin and Project Manager
job_title: Director of MIS and Systems Administrator in Honolulu, HI
pros: Great people with a servant leadership mission
cons: Salaries come in well below what is required to replace the people that move on. This makes it quite difficult to meet departmental personnel needs.

pros: People are very friendly. Like a family. Salary and benefits are better than most places in Honolulu.
cons: Sometimes no coordination between offices. Not a lot of communication from administrators.

pros: Beautiful campus, great motivated students caring faculty.
cons:
There really are no cons, I feel the administration is fair and determined to maintain a great

job_title: Residence Hall Director in Honolulu, HI
pros: The overall environment was perfect. Great group of people!
cons: Nothing to complain about. Some other do complain about the hill.

job_title: Enrollment Content Specialist in Honolulu, HI
pros: Real family oriented work-place with that "small-town" atmosphere.
cons: Generally below-average pay and internal politics tend to hinder any major progress.

pros: Make your own hours, great staff, free food, get to know students
